solution.text:
Yes
Can be represented as xy = k as field size is constant.
So, as the number of buffaloes (x) increases the number of days they take to finish grazing (y) decreases and vice versa
The two quantities are inversely proportional.

content.text: Number of buffaloes (x) that graze a field and the number of days(y) they take to finish grazing one field

The two quantities are inversely proportional.

As x increases, y decreases and vice versa.

content.text: Two quantities x and y such that \( x = \frac {15}y \)
State whether the following quantities are inversely proportional or not:

hint.text: Remember that any two quantities that can be represented as xy=k, where k is a proportionality constant are inversely proportional to each other.

solution.text:
Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K =\( 170 \times 15 = 2550\)
Hence, when x = \(850\)
y =\( \frac {2550}{850}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) y = 3

content.text: x= 170 when y = 15. Find y when x = 850.

solution.text:
Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K = \( 24 \times 84 = 2016 \)
Hence, when x = 8
y =\( \frac {2016}{8}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) y= 252

content.text: x= 24 when y = 84. Find y when x = 8.

solution.text:

Therefore, K \(= 2116 \times 15 = 31740 \)
Hence, when y \(= 92\)
x \(= \frac {31740}{92}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 345

content.text: x = 2116 when y = 15. Find x when y= 92
Give the value of x or y given that x and y are inversely proportional:

solution.text:
Since Number of workers and number of days are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K \(= 1 \times 30\)
Now, 24 hours = 1 day
Therefore number of workers to complete job in one day \(= \frac K1 = \frac {30}{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of workers = 30

content.text: One worker can complete a job in 30 days. How many workers will it take to complete the same job in 24 hours?
Answer the following question:

hint.text: The number of workers and the number of days are inversely proportional.

solution.text:
Since the total number of workers = 60
Workers who leave the team = 30
Therefore, Workers left for the second time = 60- 30 = 30
Since the numbers of workers and number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional we get,
\( 32 \times 60\) = Constant
\(30 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time) = Constant
Therefore,\( 32 \times 60 = 30 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time)
Number of days to complete job second time =\( \frac {32 \times 60}{30} \)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of days to complete the job second time = 64

content.text: You are a contractor and are given a contract to pave a road. It takes you 60 trained workers and 32 days to finish the job. Unfortunately there is a problem and you must redo all the work again. 30 workers leave your team. How much time will it take the remaining to redo the work and complete the job for a second time?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The total number of workers and the number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional

solution.text:

Therefore, \(\frac 1a \times 160= 10 \times a\)
Hence, \( a^2 = 16\)
\(\Rightarrow\) a = 4

solution.text:
Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
Therefore, taking area constant, K = 80 \(\times\) 15 = 1200 cm\(^2\)
Hence, if Length = 30 cm
Breadth =\( \frac {1200}{30}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = 40 cm

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are 80 and 15 cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is 30 cm.

hint.text: Volume of cylinder = Pi x radius\(^2\) x height

solution.text:
Since Volume is constant, the square of radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
Pi \(\times\) Radius\(^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \( r^2 \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
Therefore, taking case 1, \(20^2 \times 160 \)= K
Hence, K= 64000
If Height= 40 cm
Radius\(^2 = \frac{K}{height}\)
Radius\(^2 = \frac{64000}{40}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = 40 cm

content.text: The volume of a right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is 160 and Radius is 20 cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is 40 cm.

solution.text:
Since distance between A and B is constant, speed and time are inversely proportional.
Speed \(\times\) time = Distance = K
But first we convert all time to minutes. Therefore,
1 hour = 60 min
Time taken by auto rickshaw = 540 min
Therefore now in case one, K = \( 540 \times 20\)
K = 10800
In the case of the car, speed = 80 km/h
Therefore time taken = \( \frac {K}{80} = \frac {10800}{80}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by car = 135 min

content.text: An auto rickshaw travels between two places A and B in 9 hours at the constant speed of 20 km/h. If a car travels at constant speed of 80 km/h, How many minutes will it take from A to B?
Solve the following:

hint.text: Each of the above quantities can be represented as inversely proportional to one another. Take a multiple of the two quantities in such a way that XY = k (proportionality constant)

solution.text:
Since the distance of the race is a constant = 2000 m
Therefore, we know the number of participants taking part and distance each participant runs are inversely proportional
Number of participants x distance each runs = total distance of race
12 \(\times\) Distance run by each participant = 2000
Distance run by each participant = \( \frac{2000}{12}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Distance run by each participant = 167 m

content.text: A 2000 metre relay race, has 4 participants in each team. Due to bad organisation, 3 times the participants come from each school and the rules are changed such that now each team has 12 participants. How much distance does each participant run?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The number of participants taking part and the distance each participant runs are inversely proportional.
